p: RSV, PIV, and HMPV were the first, sixth, and ninth most frequently detected pathogens, with prevalence of 14.8% (1690/11398), 4.4% (502/11398), and 2.8% (321/11398), respectively (Fig. 1, Table 1). The median age of patients who tested positive for these paramyxoviruses was 1.3 years (IQR, 0.4–1.8), 1.7 years (IQR, 0.6–2.5), and 2.1 years (IQR, 0.8–3.0), respectively. The sex ratio of patients positive for these three viruses was 2.4:1, 2.4:1, and 2:1, respectively.
